reviews.sentence: A Caribbean Paradise. No question this is the finest hotel on St Thomas US Virgin Islands. I spent four days at the hotel and was very pleased with the service position of the hotel on the beach and food. Staff are outstanding polite helpful and nothing seems to be too much trouble for them. Rooms are roomy clean and nicely decorated just as you would expect from the Ritz Carlton hotel group. The gardens are especially nice with large palms beautiful flowers well kept lawns and a path that runs alongside the various properties where the guest rooms. It can be a bit of a trek if you are provided a guest room at the very end of the property but calling for a bell cart is just a phone call away and arrives quickly to whisk you to the reception area or restaurants. The restaurants are good too. I dined right outside Bleuwaters Restaurant. the food and wine was great. If you are visiting St Thomas just be aware that if you take a taxi from the airport it could be a shared ride in a large van with the driver stopping at other hotels to let off passengers not uncommon in the Caribbean. I booked a private car service which although expensive at 900 from airport to the Ritz was in my opinion better than a protracted journey with multiple stops. As other reviewers have said this is a great property and worth every penny.

the perfect summer vacation. spent one week in their Destination Club with another couple. Had a beautiful 3 bedroom condo overlooking the beach and ocean. Everything was perfect at the Ritz. Dined overnight at one of their restaurants to supurb cuisine and great wine lists. Meet the Director of Club Services Jonathan Driver while on our stay and he went out of his way to take care of us. Definitely will go back.

The Ritz Carlton great facilities but over priced for what you get. While the resort is beautiful and well maintained and certainly the most luxurious on St Thomas I was expecting a little more because it was the Ritz. There was nothing wrong with our stay but I did not see a discernable difference between the Ritz and a Westin hotel or resort where the prices are lower. Drinks are outrageously priced. The drink of the day was 12 or 15 and a glass of wine was more. While near the town of Red Hook it was not possible to walk to the restaurants or to the ferry less than 10 minutes away. Each visit to town required a taxi. Rides were not expensive and the wait for a cab was not long but we would have preferred to walk. The infinity pool overlooks the ocean and the temperature of the water was perfect. We had no trouble getting lounge chairs regardless of what time we visited the pool. Lounge chairs with covers are also readily available on the beach. All water sports are included with the resort fee and included sailboats kayaks paddle boards and snorkeling. We took advantage of all. The staff at the waterfront is also very friendly. Right on the beach beside Sails the resorts casual polside restaurant you can create your own souvenir of your time on St Thomas. The vendor a lovely older woman will guide you in creating your personalized sand art using sea glass shells and wire. The activity is reasonably priced and a great souvenir. I was looking for David Yurman jewelry while on the island and was planning to visit Charlotte Amalie to do so. That changed when we met Daylene at the hotels Jewels boutique. Daylene was easy to talk to and knowledgeable. I thought the hotel shop would be more expensive than in town but she explained that Yurman jewelry as well as other well known brands were priced the same everywhere on St Thomas and other islands in the Caribbean as well. so there was no need to visit multiple shops and haggle with the sales people something I do not enjoy at all. Daylene did not have the ring and bracelet I was looking for but checked the other store locations and found both one on a different island. She told me she would have both pieces in the store the following day and that I still had plenty of time to have the ring sized before I went home. She also told me there was absolutely no obligation to buy. She took my cell phone number and said she would text me when the pieces arrived. True to her word Daylene confirmed the next day that my jewelry was in and I could stop by when it was convenient for me. I ended up purchasing both pieces and the ring was sized and back to me the following day. This was the easiest shopping experience I have had on St Thomas. Our room was spacious and while expensive included breakfast bottled water in the room and free wi fi. Bug spray is also provided in the room and I needed it. The bathroom is spacious with marble tiled floors and double sinks. I was a little surprised to see a white frilly shower curtain hanging on a bare metal rod across the walk in shower instead of a glass door or nothing at all. We visited both restaurants open for dinner and preferred Blue Water to Essence. The red snapper was fabulous. This is also the restaurant where breakfast is served each morning. The staff in the restaurants were very friendly. Nightlife is non existent. Couples and small groups of people gathered in the pool in the evenings but there was no music or bar other than in Essence. I do highly recommend Dufys Love Shack in Red Hook for an after dinner drink and dancing under the stars aka parking lot. It is a lot of funMy one complaint about the hotel other than the price of drinks was the length of time it took to check out. We left our room at 1030 am and when we arrived at the front desk really two small desks on either side of the lobby there only one person working and 3 couples ahead of us waiting to check out. With official check out time at 11 this seemed a bit odd to us especially for a Ritz hotel. We went to breakfast and when we returned we still waited about 15 minutes before we were able to check out. Again only one person was working and it turned out he was a trainee.

Beautiful Location Exceptional staff. We had a wonderful relaxing week I can not say enough about the staff at this location. everyone we came in contact with was friendly courteous and helpful from the front desk to the grounds keepers. The rooms were comfortable clean and room service was timely and detailed. The pools and beaches were comfortable and clean with plenty of staff to attend to your every need. The accessibility of wind surfers kayaks SUPs ect. was a plus for those who wanted to be adventurous on the water. We had a great time Relaxed and had fun. I would recommend and return to this location.

Quiet Getaway. We stayed at the Ritz in April 2016 for a work trip and had a great experience at the hotel. Every staff member is part of Ritz experience where they greet you on the pathways are always extremely friendly and helpful. We ate at each of the restuarants when we stayed there and each had a great selection of food. I would highly recommend getting a taxi and going to the Red Hook district for additional bars and restaurants. The hotel sits in a bay area so you still get a good beach experience but are not battling as many waves when you want to float in the ocean. The hotel overlooks St Martin island and provides a great view of the island.

Excellent stay in an incredible location. We stayed four nights at the Ritz in St Thomas and had a great experience. The service was excellent from check in to check out. We had a partial ocean view room which was well appointed and decorated. The bed was incredibly comfortable. The property sits directly on what feels like a private beach and guests are able to use the facilities at the Ritz Residences next door. When we found the Ritz pool area to be a bit crowded one day we headed to the Residences and there was no one around. We had to set up our own chairs but there were abundant towels and chair wraps available. We had a few meals in the restaurants and found the food to be fresh and tasty. Of course the food is quite pricey. but so is the food in any other restaurant we visited on the island. Highly recommended.

Friendliest staff we have ever seen. Over and over again we were amazed by the friendliness sincerity and helpfulness of the staff. They really wanted us to have a great experience there. The staff the restaurants the views from the rooms Redhok is close but not much to do there.

Beauty and Service are High Marks. This was our second time at the Ritz with my husbands company event. They handled our large group very well. Our room was wonderful with a beautiful view of the beach and a nice balcony to enjoy. I agree with other posts that the bed s are weird and uncomfortable. There is a topper on the mattress that makes for a very awkward alignment for my back. The bathroom area was strangely hot all the time. The room ventilation did not work in there. There is a long walk from the rooms to the beach and pool area. Not a problem for us but I would never be able to bring my mother to a place like this. The food was disappointing. The beach activities are the best. So many fun things to do. The staff at the beach were so helpful and friendly. I loved the HobicatsI am not sure I would pay the price to stay here on my own but I did love the time we were there. Pros location views staff. activitiesCons food getting around beds room ventilation.
The most amazing Hotel. The Ritz team is first class all the way. it is a once in a life time experience. Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

The Queen of the St Thomas. This resort hotel is the gem of the island It has old world charm mixed with a modern day elegance. The view from the lobby will take your breath away. some rooms are better than others depending on what you want to spend. Since we are not in the room much we opt for the seller option. Nice restaurants great room service great service by the pool or on the sandy private beach. I paddle boarded for the first time and the employees were very helpful. I hope the hurricane recovery ends soon so I can book again next year.

below average for price paid view from the beach but it was not maintained or cleaned. No bar service at pool or beach. Limited lunch and dinner menu. hotel side closed down during my stay and was forced to go to residential side but was not told of this at check in. no coffee delivered to my room as I asked despite wanting to charge me 6 for coffee capsules.

Very disappointed in the service for this resort. We had always heard how great Ritz Carlton was and were excited for our family vacation however our experience was NOT. Upon arrival to the resort we had to wait for 45 minutes before being taken to our room. Once we got to our room we had a huge face print and smudges on the slider door to the balcony AND a poop smear on the front of the toilet. We brought this to the resort attention and the next day the smear was cleaned however the poop smear remained for THE ENTIRE WEEK we were there. Then we ate lunch at the beach restaurant which was overpriced with very poor service. When my husband had something in the bottom of his glass of water and simply asked for a new glass the waitress was very rude and acted like it was a huge inconvenience for her. We also ended up waiting for 45 minutes for our lunch a burger and salad. really. The next day we dropped our 2 boys ages 8 and 10 at the Ambassador Club while we had meetings. Not friendly there either. When we picked them up I was simply pointed in the direction to find them because the receptionist was on the phone. Then that night we had a hole in our sheet a quarter size in the middle of the bed. WOW. I do not even have holes in my bed at home. If housekeeping did not notice that how did turn down service not. I must say the last 2 days of our week stay was better but rumor was the owner was on the premises. So sad. a 5 star resort is only 5 stars when the boss is looking. After arriving home my husband was emailed by the manager asking what time he was available for a phone call to discuss our stay. He responded with any time after 9 EST and that was in July and still has not received a phone call. He even sent a second email Same customer service we received there. such a shame it is a beautiful resort.

Great location nice facilities good people just not paying attention to customers. We stayed here for 4 nights was going to be longer but thanks to United delay and reschedule on both way of our trip. anyways that ’s a different review to write. The room was all good except there are ants at the desk area that house keeping ca n’t do anything about. It ’s at great location and the facilities and the water sports gear are all wonderful and well maintained I would not say do n’t go but here are the things we experienced. The phone in the room one of them was completed dead and again nothing they can do about it. When we call to ask for things well sometimes it comes after 30 mins sometimes it never happen and when you call to ask again they are surprised oh it have n’t got there yetThe bell man brought us to the room and then we were talking about where we are and where are the restaurants he had to go back to lobby to get a map. Then we asked about in room dining he had to go back and get a menu no info was prepd in the room. And on the day we are leaving there is a spa boklet info slipped in under the door. I would have book an appointment if I would have know about it sooner. There is tea bag in the room but when we ask for a electric cattle they went and checked then come back with. we are sorry we do n’t have one. So I asked if I can get some hot water delivered. And it never show up. I am an ambassador member and I redeemed my points for the stay but when I check out there is a room rate for 100 room charge per nice plus tax plus resort fee. this has yet to be resolved. We were in a hurry to get to the airport. But out of all that the dinner at Aloro was great we went there almost every night. One of the evenings that they had a party and the hostess could n’t sit us not even at the bar. But our favor waitress Jaheda came to rescue. She not only sit us she took care of us on top of her responsibility on the big party. So next time you are in St Thomas even if you are not staying at Ritz Carlton go to the restaurant parking it free. But I do recommend you make a reservation.

Service not up to par for a Ritz Carlton property. We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Ritz Carlton St Thomas staying in an oceanfront queen bedroom. With Bon Voy Ambassador status and previous Ritz stays my expectations were high but tempered by recent reviews and understanding that they are still recuperating from the hurricanes. However we were extremely disappointed with the consistency of service offered. We take this special trip every other year and were extremely disappointed with our stay. From the beginning we were not able to reach anyone at the hotel via phone or email to answer questions related to the reservation. One time that I did talk to someone it took over an hour on the phone to attempt to change our room type. After leaving several messages and emails for a concierge no one ever responded. Eventually our Mariot Ambassador was able to confirm everything for us before we arrived. While the check in process was simple through the ap and the welcome lovely after several calls to the front desk we were told that we would need to pay an additional 350 night for access to the Club Lounge regardless of the lifetime status. We made several requests at the concierge desk the pool deck and over the phone to reserve a pool cabana and never received any response. Half of the time when we would call for reservations or room service no one would answer the phone at all. While lounging at the beach the service was spotty and inconsistent at best. There was an issue with the Sails kitchen which prompted a very limited menu for lunch and food being prepared next to the pool beach on grills under a tent. I was not expecting just one restaurant on property to be available for meals. Our room was on the 5th floor of building E and with only one elevator on the other side of the building I would not recommend this hotel for anyone with mobility issues. There are stairs everywhere throughout the main building to and from the pool and the beach etc. The construction of the family pool was very disruptive. It was visible from every room and the hotel attempted to disguise with music that started early each morning on the pool deck with the same playlist each day. The construction definitely cuts into the pool deck and you need to reserve your pool loungers early in the morning if you want a place to sit. At the beach you need to reserve a chair early in the morning if you want to sit in the front row. The attendants were friendly but not helpful even with tips. There just did not seem to be any focus on the customer experience at this resort. A couple of staff members were very friendly Lisa from in room dining was a delight each morning but not able to hold the rest of the resort to the same standards.
Service was friendly but very slow. It was a function of not having enough staff and the restaurants not all being open.

Not so Luxurious Ritz Carlton. My fiancé and I are frequent Ritz Carlton vacationers this was our first time at the St Thomas resort and sad to say it will be our last as well. After reading reviews we understood that the hotel is just starting to come back together after the huricane renovation. Upon arrival to the hotel our check in process was very strange. We were kind of brought around to different areas of the lobby until we were sat down and someone came over to help us. It seemed like staff was unsure what to do with us. We did not like that our bags were sitting in a pile of other peoples luggages outside the hotel until our room was ready. Mind you we absolutely love the Ritz located on cayman island and all their other properties. Our hotel tour guide was great in showing us around and answering general questions. The view from the resort is stunning in itself. It was pouring our first day so we were looking to browse the shops at the hotel do anything however only their jewelry store is open all the other shops are not yet ready. To my knowledge there is no arcade or really much else to do besides lounge at the pool beach activities and excursions. Calling concierge the staff was not very knowledgeable on what stores are open which surprised us. Also we were being called by the wrong last name our entire trip do not know what was up with that. We had club access where we spent a lot of our time having drinks and munching on snacks which was nice. Our first night we ate at Bleu water restaurant the atmosphere was bland decor was lacking it came across like more of a family restaurant less of a romantic feel we were trying to go for being a steakhouse. Our food took over an hour to come out. However our food was tasty. Our next day we reserved a cabana by the pool which was nice. When we got to the pool area I let staff know we have a cabana reserved and we were told oh no they are all reserved I let them know I reserved mine a week before our trip then I was led to my cabana which was not set up yet. It was 11 am they rent out from 9 am for the day. Service was just ok. The beach is not the most enjoyable due to all the coral sea grass. This is definitely not a pure white sand beach Incase that is what you are looking for. Only one pool is open right now so everyone is congested into one area. There is a slide being built which looks fun for the kids. I highly recommend taking the ferry over to trunk bay beach in St John it was the highlight of our trip. That beach is beautiful pure and memorable. Pros. Staff was very very kind. They can drive you anywhere via golf cart should you choose not to walk. I truly feel bad writing this review because staff is so so nice however they were poorly trained lacking guidance. The room was clean and newly renovated. Bathroom was extremely spacious perks for water toilet having its own door. The property was beyond beautiful and everything is just a close walk away. Cons besides everything I mentioned already bathrobe was dirty with makeup smears. Food not good. Served raw food twice on our trip. Overall we love staying at the Ritz properties we love being club level. however there are nicer Ritz caribean locations than st Thomas they still need to get their act together here a bit to say the least. Nothing to quite rave about just yet. Food options could be better. Service at coconut cove was very strange my food was raw food is not Ritz Carlton quality. Room service food quality was not good plates came dirty and food did not look pleasant to eat. A Ceasar salad at the ritz should not be salad from a bag with bagged shredded cheese soggy pieces of bread serving as croutons and bottled dressing. Our room service chicken fingers were completely raw pink. My husband got sick. The kids can get sick this way. Where is the ritz quality. This luxury hotel giant is going down hill. No longer luxurious ritz Carlton. Please Bring in a manager and get this place right.

Terrible Service. The property itself while still partially under renovation is beginning to come along nicely. The rooms lack the wow factor but is nice enough. The real problem is with the staff. From the front desk concierge to the restaurant the service level is borderline unacceptable. You call to reserve anything and you will find yourself on hold forever. If you ask to book a restaurant you will be told they ’re fully committed even though you ask for the manager and tables magically appear. You then show up for dinner and the restaurant is half empty. The servers have attitude issues and the food is mediocre at best. The whole experience is akin to staying at a Holiday Inn or an equivalent which is unacceptable considering they carry the Ritz Carlton brand and price point. Management really needs to step up their game on staff training and quality control.

So Close to Great. So the Ritz is a beautiful hotel. The grounds the views and the people are wonderful. The rooms are tastefully decorated and well appointed and the food at the restaurants is all very good and the managers and servers are fabulous. I think the hotel probably needs more staff since they had a hard time keeping up with serving all the guests. Not sure if the kitchen is short staffed or the hotel overall but once this is rectified it will be exceptional. We still loved it.

Should not be called Ritz Carlton. I travel 6 months out of the year travel the world over. In most place ’s that have a Ritz it ’s my number one choice as I know what to expect I have never had a bad experience in all my stays. I know about the hurricanes yet after calling was assured I would not be disappointed. To start checking in was very confusing took some time. They explained nothing to me just stating how to get to my room. I was not given a map which is needed for the property nor was there one in the room. The phone systems buttons were not working after a long flight being very tired getting a busy signal from room service for 3 hours I called the front desk to be told the phone buttons do n’t work to just dial 0 for everything. Nothing in the room stated that or anything about the hotel. Room service took an hour was one of the worst meals I ever had. I tried it 2 more times with things you ca n’t mess up yet everything was bad extremely over priced. I tried the free breakfast in the restaurant once yet people had to wait 20 30 minutes to pay or to sign for the free breakfast they were getting mad at people who were getting up leaving. I would call ask for items without anyone showing up. The walkway to get anywhere in the hotel from where I was at was covered in mud at a work site never cleaned up even after I said I almost fell saw 2 others fall at the same place. There is no check in desk I never received a receipt in person or email of my stay as did the people in my cab I as they could n’t find anyone to checkout. The TV basically never worked the whole stay even though I reported it as well. The worst thing was I called to have my bags picked up by 9 am to make my flight. They never showed I called. 945. they said they would be right there. 1020am I took my bags walked up the long hill to the front of the hotel sweating profusely almost passing out. I am disabled Rooms are about 100 per day yet with the service of a cheap hotel. The 890 NewYorker hotel I stayed at before. after my trip there had 100 better food service. I book most of my hotels as this through “ AMX platinum fine hotels resorts ” this hotel is nothing close. Ritz Carlton I pay expect get better food service at your hotels resorts I have till this trip “ always ” gotten it you need to fix it. I am going back to the Virgin Isles next month yet not or ever staying at the ritz again. I talked to several people that were having the same experience. In the 35 hotels I have stayed in the last year non were even close to as bad as this stay.
